statement: You are given int[]s a, b and an int N. A positive integer x is called good if it satisfies "x is a multiple of a[i] but not a multiple of b[i]" for at least one i. Return the count of all good numbers between 1 and N, inclusive.

definition.definitionVal: int count(int[] a, int[] b, int N)

examples.note: 4, 8, 12, 16 and 20 are multiples of 4, but 12 is a multiple of 3. Thus 4, 8, 16 and 20 are good numbers.

constraints.val: N will be between 1 and 1,000,000,000, inclusive.
a will contain between 1 and 10 elements, inclusive.
a and b will contain the same number of elements.
Each element of a and b will be between 1 and N, inclusive.
